compilerArguments.name: Werror
compilerArguments.description: Report an error if there are any warnings.

compilerArguments.name: Wextra
compilerArguments.description: Enable extra checkers for K2.

compilerArguments.name: X
compilerArguments.description: Print a synopsis of advanced options.

compilerArguments.name: help
compilerArguments.description: Print a synopsis of standard options.

compilerArguments.name: nowarn
compilerArguments.description: Don't generate any warnings.

compilerArguments.name: verbose
compilerArguments.description: Enable verbose logging output.

compilerArguments.name: version
compilerArguments.description: Display the compiler version.

compilerArguments.name: P
compilerArguments.description: Pass an option to a plugin.

compilerArguments.name: XXLanguage
compilerArguments.description:
Enables/disables specified language feature.
Warning: this flag is not intended for production use. If you want to configure the language behaviour use the
-language-version or corresponding experimental feature flags.

compilerArguments.name: XXdebug-level-compiler-checks
compilerArguments.description: Enable debug level compiler checks. ATTENTION: these checks can slow compiler down or even crash it.

compilerArguments.name: XXdump-model
compilerArguments.description: Dump compilation model to specified directory for use in modularized tests.

compilerArguments.name: XXexplicit-return-types
compilerArguments.description:
Force the compiler to report errors on all public API declarations without an explicit return type.
Use the 'warning' level to issue warnings instead of errors.
This flag partially enables functionality of `-Xexplicit-api` flag, so please don't use them altogether

compilerArguments.name: XXlenient-mode
compilerArguments.description: Lenient compiler mode. When actuals are missing, placeholder declarations are generated.

compilerArguments.name: Xallow-any-scripts-in-source-roots
compilerArguments.description: Allow compiling scripts along with regular Kotlin sources.

compilerArguments.name: Xallow-condition-implies-returns-contracts
compilerArguments.description: Allow contracts that specify a limited conditional returns postcondition.

compilerArguments.name: Xallow-contracts-on-more-functions
compilerArguments.description: Allow contracts on some operators and accessors, and allow checks for erased types.

compilerArguments.name: Xallow-holdsin-contract
compilerArguments.description: Allow contracts that specify a condition that holds true inside a lambda argument.

compilerArguments.name: Xallow-kotlin-package
compilerArguments.description: Allow compiling code in the 'kotlin' package, and allow not requiring 'kotlin.stdlib' in 'module-info'.

compilerArguments.name: Xallow-reified-type-in-catch
compilerArguments.description: Allow 'catch' parameters to have reified types.

compilerArguments.name: Xannotation-default-target
Xannotation-target-all
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental language support for @all: annotation use-site target.

compilerArguments.name: Xcheck-phase-conditions
compilerArguments.description: Check pre- and postconditions of IR lowering phases.

compilerArguments.name: Xcommon-sources
compilerArguments.description:
Sources of the common module that need to be compiled together with this module in multiplatform mode.
They should be a subset of sources passed as free arguments.

compilerArguments.name: Xcompiler-plugin
compilerArguments.description: Register a compiler plugin.

compilerArguments.name: Xcompiler-plugin-order
compilerArguments.description:
Specify an execution order constraint for compiler plugins.
Order constraint can be specified using the 'pluginId' of compiler plugins.
The first specified plugin will be executed before the second plugin.
Multiple constraints can be specified by repeating this option. Cycles in constraints will cause an error.

compilerArguments.name: Xconsistent-data-class-copy-visibility
compilerArguments.description: The effect of this compiler flag is the same as applying @ConsistentCopyVisibility annotation to all data classes in the module. See https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-11914

compilerArguments.name: Xcontext-parameters
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental context parameters.

compilerArguments.name: Xcontext-receivers
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental context receivers.

compilerArguments.name: Xcontext-sensitive-resolution
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental context-sensitive resolution.

compilerArguments.name: Xdata-flow-based-exhaustiveness
compilerArguments.description: Enable `when` exhaustiveness improvements that rely on data-flow analysis.

compilerArguments.name: Xdetailed-perf
compilerArguments.description:
Enable more detailed performance statistics (Experimental).
For Native, the performance report includes execution time and lines processed per second for every individual lowering.
For WASM and JS, the performance report includes execution time and lines per second for each lowering of the first stage of compilation.

compilerArguments.name: Xdirect-java-actualization
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental direct Java actualization support.

compilerArguments.name: Xdisable-default-scripting-plugin
compilerArguments.description: Don't enable the scripting plugin by default.

compilerArguments.name: Xdisable-phases
compilerArguments.description: Disable backend phases.

compilerArguments.name: Xdont-sort-source-files
compilerArguments.description: Disable automatic sorting of source files.

compilerArguments.name: Xdont-warn-on-error-suppression
compilerArguments.description: Don't report warnings when errors are suppressed. This only affects K2.

compilerArguments.name: Xdump-directory
compilerArguments.description: Dump the backend state into this directory.

compilerArguments.name: Xdump-fqname
compilerArguments.description: Dump the declaration with the given FqName.

compilerArguments.name: Xdump-perf
compilerArguments.description:
Dump detailed performance statistics to the specified file in plain text, JSON or markdown format (it's detected by the file's extension).
Also, it supports the placeholder `*` and directory for generating file names based on the module being compiled and the current time stamp.
Example: `path/to/dir/*.log` creates logs like `path/to/dir/my-module_2025-06-20-12-22-32.log` in plain text format, `path/to/dir/` creates logs like `path/to/dir/my-log_2025-06-20-12-22-32.json`.

compilerArguments.name: Xenable-incremental-compilation
compilerArguments.description: Enable incremental compilation.

compilerArguments.name: Xexpect-actual-classes
compilerArguments.description:
'expect'/'actual' classes (including interfaces, objects, annotations, enums, and 'actual' typealiases) are in Beta.
Kotlin reports a warning every time you use one of them. You can use this flag to mute the warning.

compilerArguments.name: Xexplicit-api
compilerArguments.description:
Force the compiler to report errors on all public API declarations without an explicit visibility or a return type.
Use the 'warning' level to issue warnings instead of errors.

compilerArguments.name: Xexplicit-backing-fields
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental language support for explicit backing fields.

compilerArguments.name: Xfragment-dependency
compilerArguments.description:
Declare common klib dependencies for the specific fragment.
This argument is required for any HMPP module except the platform leaf module: it takes dependencies from -cp/-libraries.
The argument should be used only if the new compilation scheme is enabled with -Xseparate-kmp-compilation

compilerArguments.name: Xfragment-friend-dependency
compilerArguments.description:
Declare common klib friend dependencies for the specific fragment.
This argument can be specified for any HMPP module except the platform leaf module: it takes dependencies from the platform specific friend module arguments.
The argument should be used only if the new compilation scheme is enabled with -Xseparate-kmp-compilation

compilerArguments.name: Xfragment-refines
compilerArguments.description: Declare that <fromModuleName> refines <onModuleName> with the dependsOn/refines relation.

compilerArguments.name: Xfragment-sources
compilerArguments.description: Add sources to a specific fragment of a multiplatform compilation.

compilerArguments.name: Xfragments
compilerArguments.description: Declare all known fragments of a multiplatform compilation.

compilerArguments.name: Xheader-mode
compilerArguments.description:
Enable header compilation mode.
In this mode, the compiler produces class files that only contain the 'skeleton' of the classes to be
compiled but the method bodies of all the implementations are empty.  This is used to speed up parallel compilation
build systems where header libraries can be used to replace downstream dependencies for which we only need to
see the type names and method signatures required to compile a given translation unit. Inline functions are still kept
with bodies.

compilerArguments.name: Xignore-const-optimization-errors
compilerArguments.description: Ignore all compilation exceptions while optimizing some constant expressions.

compilerArguments.name: Xinline-classes
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental inline classes.

compilerArguments.name: Xintellij-plugin-root
compilerArguments.description: Path to 'kotlin-compiler.jar' or the directory where the IntelliJ IDEA configuration files can be found.

compilerArguments.name: Xlist-phases
compilerArguments.description: List backend phases.

compilerArguments.name: Xlocal-type-aliases
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental language support for local type aliases.

compilerArguments.name: Xmetadata-klib
compilerArguments.description: Produce a klib that only contains the metadata of declarations.

compilerArguments.name: Xmetadata-version
compilerArguments.description: Change the metadata version of the generated binary files.

compilerArguments.name: Xmulti-dollar-interpolation
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental multi-dollar interpolation.

compilerArguments.name: Xmulti-platform
compilerArguments.description: Enable language support for multiplatform projects.

compilerArguments.name: Xname-based-destructuring
Xnested-type-aliases
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental language support for nested type aliases.

compilerArguments.name: Xnew-inference
compilerArguments.description: Enable the new experimental generic type inference algorithm.

compilerArguments.name: Xno-check-actual
compilerArguments.description: Do not check for the presence of the 'actual' modifier in multiplatform projects.

compilerArguments.name: Xno-inline
compilerArguments.description: Disable method inlining.

compilerArguments.name: Xnon-local-break-continue
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental non-local break and continue.

compilerArguments.name: Xphases-to-dump
compilerArguments.description: Dump the backend's state both before and after these phases.

compilerArguments.name: Xphases-to-dump-after
compilerArguments.description: Dump the backend's state after these phases.

compilerArguments.name: Xphases-to-dump-before
compilerArguments.description: Dump the backend's state before these phases.

compilerArguments.name: Xphases-to-validate
compilerArguments.description: Validate the backend's state both before and after these phases.

compilerArguments.name: Xphases-to-validate-after
compilerArguments.description: Validate the backend's state after these phases.

compilerArguments.name: Xphases-to-validate-before
compilerArguments.description: Validate the backend's state before these phases.

compilerArguments.name: Xplugin
compilerArguments.description: Load plugins from the given classpath.

compilerArguments.name: Xprofile-phases
compilerArguments.description: Profile backend phases.

compilerArguments.name: Xrender-internal-diagnostic-names
compilerArguments.description: Render the internal names of warnings and errors.

compilerArguments.name: Xrepl
compilerArguments.description: Run Kotlin REPL (deprecated)

compilerArguments.name: Xreport-all-warnings
compilerArguments.description: Report all warnings even if errors are found.

compilerArguments.name: Xreport-output-files
compilerArguments.description: Report the source-to-output file mapping.

compilerArguments.name: Xreport-perf
compilerArguments.description: Report detailed performance statistics.

compilerArguments.name: Xreturn-value-checker
compilerArguments.description: Set improved unused return value checker mode. Use 'check' to run checker only and use 'full' to also enable automatic annotation insertion.

compilerArguments.name: Xseparate-kmp-compilation
compilerArguments.description: Enables the separated compilation scheme, in which common source sets are analyzed against their own dependencies

compilerArguments.name: Xskip-metadata-version-check
compilerArguments.description: Allow loading classes with bad metadata versions and pre-release classes.

compilerArguments.name: Xskip-prerelease-check
compilerArguments.description: Allow loading pre-release classes.

compilerArguments.name: Xstdlib-compilation
compilerArguments.description: Enables special features which are relevant only for stdlib compilation.

compilerArguments.name: Xsuppress-api-version-greater-than-language-version-error
compilerArguments.description:
Suppress error about API version greater than language version.
Warning: This is temporary solution (see KT-63712) intended to be used only for stdlib build.

compilerArguments.name: Xsuppress-version-warnings
compilerArguments.description: Suppress warnings about outdated, inconsistent, or experimental language or API versions.

compilerArguments.name: Xsuppress-warning
compilerArguments.description: Suppress specified warning module-wide. This option is deprecated in favor of "-Xwarning-level" flag

compilerArguments.name: Xunrestricted-builder-inference
compilerArguments.description: Eliminate builder inference restrictions, for example by allowing type variables to be returned from builder inference calls.

compilerArguments.name: Xuse-fir-experimental-checkers
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental frontend IR checkers that are not yet ready for production.

compilerArguments.name: Xuse-fir-ic
compilerArguments.description:
Compile using frontend IR internal incremental compilation.
Warning: This feature is not yet production-ready.

compilerArguments.name: Xuse-fir-lt
compilerArguments.description: Compile using the LightTree parser with the frontend IR.

compilerArguments.name: Xverbose-phases
compilerArguments.description: Be verbose while performing the given backend phases.

compilerArguments.name: Xverify-ir
compilerArguments.description: IR verification mode (no verification by default).

compilerArguments.name: Xverify-ir-nested-offsets
compilerArguments.description: Check that offsets of nested IR elements conform to offsets of their containers. Only has effect if '-Xverify-ir' is not 'none'.

compilerArguments.name: Xverify-ir-visibility
compilerArguments.description: Check for visibility violations in IR when validating it before running any lowerings. Only has effect if '-Xverify-ir' is not 'none'.

compilerArguments.name: Xwarning-level
compilerArguments.description:
Set the severity of the given warning.
- `error` level raises the severity of a warning to error level (similar to -Werror but more granular)
- `disabled` level suppresses reporting of a warning (similar to -nowarn but more granular)
- `warning` level overrides -nowarn and -Werror for this specific warning (the warning will be reported/won't be considered as an error)

compilerArguments.name: Xwhen-guards
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental language support for when guards.

compilerArguments.name: api-version
compilerArguments.description: Allow using declarations from only the specified version of bundled libraries.

compilerArguments.name: kotlin-home
compilerArguments.description: Path to the Kotlin compiler home directory used for the discovery of runtime libraries.

compilerArguments.name: language-version
compilerArguments.description: Provide source compatibility with the specified version of Kotlin.

compilerArguments.name: opt-in
compilerArguments.description: Enable API usages that require opt-in with an opt-in requirement marker with the given fully qualified name.

compilerArguments.name: progressive
compilerArguments.description:
Enable progressive compiler mode.
In this mode, deprecations and bug fixes for unstable code take effect immediately
instead of going through a graceful migration cycle.
Code written in progressive mode is backward compatible; however, code written without
progressive mode enabled may cause compilation errors in progressive mode.

compilerArguments.name: script
compilerArguments.description: Evaluate the given Kotlin script (*.kts) file.

compilerArguments.name: Xabi-stability
compilerArguments.description:
When using unstable compiler features such as FIR, use 'stable' to mark generated class files as stable
to prevent diagnostics from being reported when using stable compilers at the call site.
When using the JVM IR backend, conversely, use 'unstable' to mark generated class files as unstable
to force diagnostics to be reported.

compilerArguments.name: Xadd-modules
compilerArguments.description: Root modules to resolve in addition to the initial modules, or all modules on the module path if <module> is ALL-MODULE-PATH.

compilerArguments.name: Xallow-no-source-files
compilerArguments.description: Allow the set of source files to be empty.

compilerArguments.name: Xallow-unstable-dependencies
compilerArguments.description: Do not report errors on classes in dependencies that were compiled by an unstable version of the Kotlin compiler.

compilerArguments.name: Xannotations-in-metadata
compilerArguments.description: Write annotations on declarations into the metadata (in addition to the JVM bytecode), and read annotations from the metadata if they are present.

compilerArguments.name: Xassertions
Xbackend-threads
compilerArguments.description:
Run codegen phase in N parallel threads.
0 means use one thread per processor core.
The default value is 1.

compilerArguments.name: Xbuild-file
compilerArguments.description: Path to the .xml build file to compile.

compilerArguments.name: Xcompile-builtins-as-part-of-stdlib
compilerArguments.description: Enable behaviour needed to compile builtins as part of JVM stdlib

compilerArguments.name: Xcompile-java
compilerArguments.description: Reuse 'javac' analysis and compile Java source files.

compilerArguments.name: Xdebug
compilerArguments.description:
Enable debug mode for compilation.
Currently this includes spilling all variables in a suspending context regardless of whether they are alive.
If API Level >= 2.2 -- no-op.

compilerArguments.name: Xdefault-script-extension
compilerArguments.description: Compile expressions and unrecognized scripts passed with the -script argument as scripts with the given filename extension.

compilerArguments.name: Xdisable-standard-script
compilerArguments.description: Disable standard Kotlin scripting support.

compilerArguments.name: Xemit-jvm-type-annotations
compilerArguments.description: Emit JVM type annotations in bytecode.

compilerArguments.name: Xenhance-type-parameter-types-to-def-not-null
compilerArguments.description: Enhance not-null-annotated type parameter types to definitely-non-nullable types ('@NotNull T' => 'T & Any').

compilerArguments.name: Xenhanced-coroutines-debugging
compilerArguments.description:
Generate additional linenumber instruction for compiler-generated code
inside suspend functions and lambdas to distinguish them from user code by debugger.

compilerArguments.name: Xfriend-paths
compilerArguments.description: Paths to output directories for friend modules (modules whose internals should be visible).

compilerArguments.name: Xgenerate-strict-metadata-version
compilerArguments.description: Generate metadata with strict version semantics (see the KDoc entry on 'Metadata.extraInt').

compilerArguments.name: Xignored-annotations-for-bridges
compilerArguments.description: Do not copy these annotations to the bridge methods from their targets.

compilerArguments.name: Xindy-allow-annotated-lambdas
compilerArguments.description: Allow using 'invokedynamic' for lambda expressions with annotations

compilerArguments.name: Xir-do-not-clear-binding-context
compilerArguments.description: When using the IR backend, do not clear BindingContext between 'psi2ir' and lowerings.

compilerArguments.name: Xjava-package-prefix
compilerArguments.description: Package prefix for Java files.

compilerArguments.name: Xjava-source-roots
compilerArguments.description: Paths to directories with Java source files.

compilerArguments.name: Xjavac-arguments
compilerArguments.description: Java compiler arguments.

compilerArguments.name: Xjdk-release
compilerArguments.description:
Compile against the specified JDK API version, similarly to javac's '-release'. This requires JDK 9 or newer.
The supported versions depend on the JDK used; for JDK 17+, the supported versions are 1.8 and 925.
This also sets the value of '-jvm-target' to be equal to the selected JDK version.

compilerArguments.name: Xjspecify-annotations
compilerArguments.description:
Specify the behavior of 'jspecify' annotations.
The default value is 'strict'.

compilerArguments.name: Xjsr305
compilerArguments.description:
Specify the behavior of 'JSR-305' nullability annotations:
-Xjsr305={ignore/strict/warn}                   global (all non-@UnderMigration annotations)
-Xjsr305=under-migration:{ignore/strict/warn}   all @UnderMigration annotations
-Xjsr305=@<fq.name>:{ignore/strict/warn}        annotation with the given fully qualified class name
Modes:
* ignore
* strict (experimental; treat like other supported nullability annotations)
* warn (report a warning)

compilerArguments.name: Xjvm-default
compilerArguments.description:
This option is deprecated. Migrate to -jvm-default as follows:
-Xjvm-default=disable            -> -jvm-default=disable
-Xjvm-default=all-compatibility  -> -jvm-default=enable
-Xjvm-default=all                -> -jvm-default=no-compatibility

compilerArguments.name: Xjvm-enable-preview
compilerArguments.description:
Allow using Java features that are in the preview phase.
This works like '--enable-preview' in Java. All class files are marked as compiled with preview features, meaning it won't be possible to use them in release environments.

compilerArguments.name: Xjvm-expose-boxed
compilerArguments.description: Expose inline classes and functions, accepting and returning them, to Java.

compilerArguments.name: Xklib
compilerArguments.description: Paths to cross-platform libraries in the .klib format.

compilerArguments.name: Xlambdas
compilerArguments.description:
Select the code generation scheme for lambdas.
-Xlambdas=indy                  Generate lambdas using 'invokedynamic' with 'LambdaMetafactory.metafactory'.
                                A lambda object created using 'LambdaMetafactory.metafactory' will have a different 'toString()'.
-Xlambdas=class                 Generate lambdas as explicit classes.
The default value is 'indy' if language version is 2.0+, and 'class' otherwise.

compilerArguments.name: Xlink-via-signatures
compilerArguments.description:
Link JVM IR symbols via signatures instead of descriptors.
This mode is slower, but it can be useful for troubleshooting problems with the JVM IR backend.
This option is deprecated and will be deleted in future versions.
It has no effect when -language-version is 2.0 or higher.

compilerArguments.name: Xmodule-path
compilerArguments.description: Paths to Java 9+ modules.

compilerArguments.name: Xmultifile-parts-inherit
compilerArguments.description: Compile multifile classes as a hierarchy of parts and a facade.

compilerArguments.name: Xno-call-assertions
compilerArguments.description: Don't generate not-null assertions for arguments of platform types.

compilerArguments.name: Xno-new-java-annotation-targets
compilerArguments.description: Don't generate Java 1.8+ targets for Kotlin annotation classes.

compilerArguments.name: Xno-optimize
compilerArguments.description: Disable optimizations.

compilerArguments.name: Xno-param-assertions
compilerArguments.description: Don't generate not-null assertions on parameters of methods accessible from Java.

compilerArguments.name: Xno-receiver-assertions
compilerArguments.description: Don't generate not-null assertions for extension receiver arguments of platform types.

compilerArguments.name: Xno-reset-jar-timestamps
compilerArguments.description: Don't reset jar entry timestamps to a fixed date.

compilerArguments.name: Xno-source-debug-extension
compilerArguments.description: Don't generate the '@kotlin.jvm.internal.SourceDebugExtension' annotation with an SMAP copy on classes.

compilerArguments.name: Xno-unified-null-checks
compilerArguments.description: Use pre-1.4 exception types instead of 'java.lang.NPE' in null checks. See KT-22275 for more details.

compilerArguments.name: Xnullability-annotations
compilerArguments.description:
Specify the behavior for specific Java nullability annotations (provided with fully qualified package name).
Modes:
* ignore
* strict
* warn (report a warning)

compilerArguments.name: Xoutput-builtins-metadata
compilerArguments.description: Output builtins metadata as .kotlin_builtins files

compilerArguments.name: Xprofile
compilerArguments.description:
Debug option: Run the compiler with the async profiler and save snapshots to `outputDir`; `command` is passed to the async profiler on start.
`profilerPath` is the path to libasyncProfiler.so; async-profiler.jar should be on the compiler classpath.
If it's not on the classpath, the compiler will attempt to load async-profiler.jar from the containing directory of profilerPath.
Example: -Xprofile=<PATH_TO_ASYNC_PROFILER>/async-profiler/build/libasyncProfiler.so:event=cpu,interval=1ms,threads,start:<SNAPSHOT_DIR_PATH>

compilerArguments.name: Xsam-conversions
compilerArguments.description:
Select the code generation scheme for SAM conversions.
-Xsam-conversions=indy          Generate SAM conversions using 'invokedynamic' with 'LambdaMetafactory.metafactory'.
-Xsam-conversions=class         Generate SAM conversions as explicit classes.
The default value is 'indy'.

compilerArguments.name: Xsanitize-parentheses
compilerArguments.description:
Transform '(' and ')' in method names to some other character sequence.
This mode can BREAK BINARY COMPATIBILITY and should only be used as a workaround for
problems with parentheses in identifiers on certain platforms.

compilerArguments.name: Xscript-resolver-environment
compilerArguments.description: Set the script resolver environment in key-value pairs (the value can be quoted and escaped).

compilerArguments.name: Xserialize-ir
compilerArguments.description: Save the IR to metadata (Experimental).

compilerArguments.name: Xstring-concat
compilerArguments.description:
Select the code generation scheme for string concatenation:
-Xstring-concat=indy-with-constants  Concatenate strings using 'invokedynamic' and 'makeConcatWithConstants'. This requires '-jvm-target 9' or greater.
-Xstring-concat=indy                 Concatenate strings using 'invokedynamic' and 'makeConcat'. This requires '-jvm-target 9' or greater.
-Xstring-concat=inline               Concatenate strings using 'StringBuilder'
default: 'indy-with-constants' for JVM targets 9 or greater, 'inline' otherwise.

compilerArguments.name: Xsupport-compatqual-checker-framework-annotations
compilerArguments.description:
Specify the behavior for Checker Framework 'compatqual' annotations ('NullableDecl'/'NonNullDecl').
The default value is 'enable'.

compilerArguments.name: Xsuppress-deprecated-jvm-target-warning
compilerArguments.description:
Suppress warnings about deprecated JVM target versions.
This option has no effect and will be deleted in a future version.

compilerArguments.name: Xsuppress-missing-builtins-error
compilerArguments.description: Suppress the "cannot access built-in declaration" error (useful with '-no-stdlib').

compilerArguments.name: Xtype-enhancement-improvements-strict-mode
compilerArguments.description:
Enable strict mode for improvements to type enhancement for loaded Java types based on nullability annotations,
including the ability to read type-use annotations from class files.
See KT-45671 for more details.

compilerArguments.name: Xuse-14-inline-classes-mangling-scheme
compilerArguments.description: Use the scheme for inline class mangling from version 1.4 instead of the one from 1.4.30.

compilerArguments.name: Xuse-fast-jar-file-system
compilerArguments.description: Use the fast implementation of Jar FS. This may speed up compilation time, but it is experimental.

compilerArguments.name: Xuse-inline-scopes-numbers
compilerArguments.description: Use inline scopes numbers for inline marker variables.

compilerArguments.name: Xuse-javac
compilerArguments.description: Use javac for Java source and class file analysis.

compilerArguments.name: Xuse-old-class-files-reading
compilerArguments.description:
Use the old implementation for reading class files. This may slow down the compilation and cause problems with Groovy interop.
This can be used in the event of problems with the new implementation.

compilerArguments.name: Xuse-type-table
compilerArguments.description: Use a type table in metadata serialization.

compilerArguments.name: Xvalidate-bytecode
compilerArguments.description: Validate generated JVM bytecode before and after optimizations.

compilerArguments.name: Xvalue-classes
compilerArguments.description: Enable experimental value classes.

compilerArguments.name: Xwhen-expressions
compilerArguments.description:
Select the code generation scheme for type-checking 'when' expressions:
-Xwhen-expressions=indy         Generate type-checking 'when' expressions using 'invokedynamic' with 'SwitchBootstraps.typeSwitch(..)' and 
                                following 'tableswitch' or 'lookupswitch'. This requires '-jvm-target 21' or greater.
-Xwhen-expressions=inline       Generate type-checking 'when' expressions as a chain of type checks.
The default value is 'inline'.

compilerArguments.name: classpath
compilerArguments.description: List of directories and JAR/ZIP archives to search for user class files.

compilerArguments.name: d
compilerArguments.description: Destination for generated class files.

compilerArguments.name: expression
compilerArguments.description: Evaluate the given string as a Kotlin script.

compilerArguments.name: include-runtime
compilerArguments.description: Include the Kotlin runtime in the resulting JAR.

compilerArguments.name: java-parameters
compilerArguments.description: Generate metadata for Java 1.8 reflection on method parameters.

compilerArguments.name: jdk-home
compilerArguments.description: Include a custom JDK from the specified location in the classpath instead of the default 'JAVA_HOME'.

compilerArguments.name: jvm-default
compilerArguments.description:
Emit JVM default methods for interface declarations with bodies. The default is 'enable'.
-jvm-default=enable              Generate default methods for non-abstract interface declarations, as well as 'DefaultImpls' classes with
                                 static methods for compatibility with code compiled in the 'disable' mode.
                                 This is the default behavior since language version 2.2.
-jvm-default=no-compatibility    Generate default methods for non-abstract interface declarations. Do not generate 'DefaultImpls' classes.
-jvm-default=disable             Do not generate JVM default methods. This is the default behavior up to language version 2.1.

compilerArguments.name: jvm-target
compilerArguments.description: The target version of the generated JVM bytecode (1.8 and 925), with 1.8 as the default.

compilerArguments.name: module-name
compilerArguments.description: Name of the generated '.kotlin_module' file.

compilerArguments.name: no-jdk
compilerArguments.description: Don't automatically include the Java runtime in the classpath.

compilerArguments.name: no-reflect
compilerArguments.description: Don't automatically include the Kotlin reflection dependency in the classpath.

compilerArguments.name: no-stdlib
compilerArguments.description: Don't automatically include the Kotlin/JVM stdlib and Kotlin reflection dependencies in the classpath.

compilerArguments.name: script-templates
compilerArguments.description: Script definition template classes.
